channel.title: Vista - Variables!
channel.description: How do I set up enviromental variables on vista... is there something else i need to do?

item.title: Vista - Variables!
item.dc:creator: @hipeanutbutter hipeanutbutter
item.description:
@hipeanutbutter wrote:

use this for your enviorment variable

Name:PATH
Variable:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin

Read full topic

environmental variables
are anyone mind explaining?

[/quote]

are you a vista user? i am.[/quote] Yes, both of my computers are Vista

item.title: Vista - Variables!
item.dc:creator: @danielknuckles danielknuckles
item.description:
@danielknuckles wrote:

It's pretty much the same as on XP, plus if you can't even get a server working what makes you think you will be able to make one?
I have vista and I have had many servers with lots of people on and I didn't need to set variables on either of my computers :\

Read full topic

item.title: Vista - Variables!
item.dc:creator: @Goran Goran
item.description:
@Goran wrote:

i got the code for vista cuz i got one too

CLASSPATH- CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

PATH- C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin

Read full topic

item.title: Vista - Variables!
item.dc:creator: @lolwut69 lolwut69
item.description:
@lolwut69 wrote:

[quote=“Defiance, post:3, topic:257621”]I made one before, never on vista. It does not work the same way at all.[/quote]Click the start button/orb, click control panel, click system, click advanced system settings, click environmental variables and there you go. That wasn’t so hard was it?

Read full topic
